basics.name: Anuj Patel
basics.label: Data Scientist, AI & Machine Learning Engineer
basics.summary: Graduate student at New York University with a strong passion for Data Science, High Performance Machine Learning and Wireless Communications

work.name: Johnson & Johnson
work.summary: Developed ML models to improve performance of devices used in open laparoscopic surgeries.

work.name: Indian Space Research Organization
work.summary: Researched on various measures to improve space-to-ground BB84 Quantum Key Distribution processes.

work.name: Indian Oil Corporation Ltd.
work.summary: Examined MPLS and SD-WAN technologies in the M(IS) department at Gujarat Refinery & Optimized the intricate operations of the preliminary refining pipelines in Atmospheric Unit (AU) IV.

volunteer.summary: Supervised activities at Rasotsav-22 for the Blind People’s Association and taught Science, Math, Computer, and Chess to ~100 students requiring special needs in grades 9-12.
highlights: Directly managed 15+ events impacting 100+ children with distinct support needs and 100+ volunteers.

volunteer.organization: NYU Student Government Assembly (New York University)
volunteer.summary: Advocated for graduate student interests in university senate meetings, influencing policies to enhance campus safety, diversity, and inclusivity.
highlights: Organized 30+ events and tabling sessions impacting 10000+ students, faculty and staff.

volunteer.summary: Led 40+ orientation leaders to onboard 1,600+ students at NYU Tandon, organizing inclusive events to foster community and ensure a seamless orientation experience during Fall 2024 and Spring 2025.
highlights: Managed 20+ events within a span of 3 days to provide a remarkable welcome to incoming students.

awards.title: Emerging Leaders Award (GR)
awards.summary: Recognized for outstanding leadership initiatives and student engagement at NYU Tandon School of Engineering.

awards.title: NYU Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Received $8000/yr in recognition of previous academic achievements.

awards.title: NYU Tandon Ambassador Scholarship
awards.summary: Received $4300 in recognition for being a NYU Tandon Ambassador.

publications.name: Intelligent Road Illumination Network using IoT
publications.publisher: International Journal for Research in Applied Science and Engineering Technology
publications.summary: Developed a novel road illumination system using IoT and embedded controlllers, saving 85% energy and intelligent load balancing.

publications.name: Automated Toll Collection System with Vehicle Categorization and Enhanced Security
publications.publisher: International Research Journal of Engineering and Technology
publications.summary: Developed an automated toll collection system leveraging RFID and IoT technologies to optimize toll plaza operations, enhance security, and reduce congestion by 40%.

skills.name: Programming Languages
keywords: Python, MATLAB, R, C/C++, Java, Bash, SQL, LabVIEW

skills.name: Data Science & Machine Learning
keywords: PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, Scikit-Learn, NumPy, Pandas, MLFlow, Flyte, CUDA Programming, MLOps, BERT, T5, GPT, A/B Testing

projects.name: Efficient Federated Learning
projects.summary: Pioneered an efficient FL framework with gradient-based pruning and adaptive federated optimization to mitigate I/O overheads, cutting training time by 22% and boosting model generalization in distributed systems. Increased bandwidth efficiency by 143% using gradient compression techniques and mix-precision training, ensuring accuracy on ResNet models with PyTorch DDP, DeepSpeed and Hugging Face Accelerate.
highlights: Federated Learning, Distributed Systems, Distributed Deep Learning, High Performance Computing

projects.name: Movie Recommendation System with NCF
projects.summary: Built and deployed a scalable movie recommendation system using NCF, achieving 50% Hit Ratio on MovieLens 1M with distributed Spark processing and SQL integration for data warehousing. Streamlined a 1M-record data pipeline with preprocessing, negative sampling, SQL-driven backend, and a Streamlit frontend, reducing recommendation retrieval time by 33%.
highlights: Recommendation Systems, Neural Collaborative Filtering, Statistical Data Analysis

projects.name: Multimodal Emotion Recognition
projects.summary: Enhanced a transformer based framework for emotion recognition, achieving 33.96% top-1 and 98.13% top-5 precision on RAVDESS data integrating both facial and vocal cues. Applied advanced modality fusion techniques with feature extraction and preprocessing pipelines, processing 4,000+ video and audio signals to improve robustness in noisy/incomplete datasets.
highlights: Multimodal Emotion Recognition, Transformer Models, Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Speech Processing

projects.name: Multi-User Massive MIMO Channel Estimation
projects.summary: Utilized MATLAB’s 5G toolbox for ray tracing a Remcom Wireless scenario with indoor sub-6G massive MIMO system at 2.5 GHz, generating 4 channel datasets with varying base stations and one-bit quantization based on pilot sequences. Developed a cGAN-based channel estimation method that outperformed U-Net, CNN, and MLP approaches, achieving significant dB gains at lower SNRs and producing channel images closely matching the ground truth channel.
highlights: Channel Estimation, 5G Protocols, Wireless Communications, Signal Processing, Ray Tracing, Generative Adversarial Networks
